svcsubproc.title: Pinpoint Tests

para.emph: Pinpoint Test A: A Single Door Lock Is Inoperative

svcsubproc.para: When both doors are locked and the LH door lock rod is moved to the UNLOCK position, or the UNLOCK button on the remote keyless entry (RKE) remote transmitter (if equipped) is pressed, ground is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). When the door lock timer receives ground on circuit 119 (PK/YE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 118 (PK/OG), and ground through circuit 117 (PK/BK) and the doors will UNLOCK.

When both doors are unlocked and the LH side door lock rod is moved to the LOCK position, 12 volts from circuit 120 (PK/LG) is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). If equipped with RKE and the LOCK button on the RKE remote transmitter is pressed, the RKE module sends reference voltage to the door lock timer through circuit 129 (LG). When the door lock timer receives reference voltage on circuit 119 (PK/YE), or on circuit 129 (LG) (if equipped with RKE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 117 (PK/BK), and ground through circuit 118 (PK/OG) and the doors will LOCK.

item.para: Binding or stuck door lock mechanism
Inoperative LH or RH door latch remote control
Open in circuits 57 (BK), 118 (PK/OG) or 119 (PK/YE)
Inoperative door lock timer

table.title: PINPOINT TEST A: A SINGLE DOOR LOCK IS INOPERATIVE

para.emph: A1 CHECK THE MANUAL OPERATION OF THE SUSPECT DOOR LOCK

item.para: Manually operate the inoperative door lock.
Check for binding or a stuck condition.

para.emph: Is the lock stuck or binding?

entry.para: REPAIR binding components as necessary. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Disconnect: LH Door Latch Remote Control C552 or RH Door Latch Remote Control C641

NOTE: In a normally operating system, voltage on circuit 117 (PK/BK) will only be present for a short period of time after the fused jumper wire is connected. It may be necessary to remove and reconnect the fused jumper wire in order to measure the voltage.

For an inoperative LH door lock, while measuring the voltage between LH door latch remote control C552-3, circuit 118 (PK/OG) harness side and LH door latch remote control C552-4, circuit 117 (PK/BK) harness side, momentarily connect a fused jumper wire between LH door latch remote control C552-1, circuit 57 (BK) harness side and LH door latch remote control C552-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) harness side.
For an inoperative RH door lock, measure the voltage between RH door latch remote control C641-5, circuit 117 (PK/BK) harness side and ground, while operating the LH door lock switch.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts at any time?

item.para: NOTE: In a normally operating system, voltage on circuit 118 (PK/OG) will only be present for a short period of time after the fused jumper wire is connected. It may be necessary to remove and reconnect the fused jumper wire in order to measure the resistance.

For an inoperative LH door lock, while measuring the voltage between LH door latch remote control C552-3, circuit 118 (PK/OG) harness side and ground, momentarily connect a fused jumper wire between LH door latch remote control C552-1, circuit 57 (BK) harness side and LH door latch remote control C552-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) harness side.
For an inoperative RH door lock, measure the voltage between RH door latch remote control C641-2, circuit 118 (PK/OG) harness side and ground, while operating the LH door lock switch.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts at any time?

entry.para: INSTALL a new LH or RH door latch remote control. REFER to Door Latch Remote Control in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A4 CHECK CIRCUITS 117 (PK/BK) AND 118 (PK/OG) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect: Door Lock Timer Module C2333
Using the following table, measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333 and the inoperative door latch remote control connector, harness side:

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A5 CHECK DOOR LOCK TIMER CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333-5, circuit 57 (BK) harness side and ground; and between door lock timer C2333-12, circuit 57 (BK) harness side and ground.

para.emph: Are both resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A6 CHECK THE DOOR LOCK TIMER FOR CORRECT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all door lock timer connectors.
Check for:
corrosion.
pushed-out pins.
damaged connectors.
Connect all door lock timer connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new door lock timer. REFER to Door Lock Timer in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. Concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test B: All Door Locks Are Inoperative

svcsubproc.para: When both doors are locked and the LH door lock rod is moved to the UNLOCK position, or the UNLOCK button on the remote keyless entry (RKE) remote transmitter (if equipped) is pressed, ground is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). When the door lock timer receives ground on circuit 119 (PK/YE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 118 (PK/OG), and ground through circuit 117 (PK/BK) and the doors will UNLOCK.

When both doors are unlocked and the LH side door lock rod is moved to the LOCK position, 12 volts from circuit 120 (PK/LG) is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). If equipped with RKE and the LOCK button on the RKE remote transmitter is pressed, the RKE module sends 12 volts to the door lock timer through circuit 129 (LG). When the door lock timer receives 12 volts on circuit 119 (PK/YE), or on circuit 129 (LG) (if equipped with RKE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 117 (PK/BK), and ground through circuit 118 (PK/OG) and the doors will LOCK.

item.para: Fuse
Open in circuits 57 (BK), 117 (PK/BK), 118 (PK/OG), 119 (PK/YE), 120 (PK/LG) or 1679 (WH/YE)
Door lock timer

table.title: PINPOINT TEST B: ALL DOOR LOCKS ARE INOPERATIVE

item.para: Disconnect: Door Lock Timer C2333
Measure the voltage between door lock timer C2333-1, circuit 1679 (WH/YE) and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: VERIFY the power distribution center (PDC) fuse 9 (20A) is OK. If OK, REPAIR circuit 1679 (WH/YE) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B2 CHECK DOOR LOCK TIMER CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333-5, circuit 57 (BK) harness side, and door lock timer C2333-12, circuit 57 (BK) harness side.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B3 CHECK THE LH DOOR LATCH REMOTE CONTROL

item.para: Disconnect:LH Door Latch Remote Control C552
Set the LH door latch remote control to the UNLOCK position.
Measure the resistance between LH door latch remote control C2333-1, circuit 57 (BK) component side, and LH door latch remote control C2333-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) component side.
Set the LH door latch remote control to the LOCK position.
Measure the resistance between LH door latch remote control C2333-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) component side, and LH door latch remote control C2333-5, circuit 119 (PK/YE) component side.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new LH door latch remote control. REFER to Door Latch Remote Control in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B4 CHECK CIRCUITS 117 (PK/BK) AND 118 (PK/OG) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect:RH Door Latch Remote Control C641
Using the following table, measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333, LH door latch remote control C552, RH door latch remote control C641 and harness side:

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B5 CHECK CIRCUITS 119 (PK/YE) AND 120 (PK/LG) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Using the following table, measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333, and LH door latch remote control C552, harness side:

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B6 CHECK LH DOOR LATCH REMOTE CONTROL CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between LH door latch remote control C552-1, circuit 57 (BK) and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B7 CHECK THE DOOR LOCK TIMER FOR CORRECT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all door lock timer connectors.
Check for:
corrosion.
pushed-out pins.
damaged connectors.
Connect all door lock timer connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new door lock timer. REFER to Door Lock Timer in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. Concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test C: The Door Locks Only Operate One Way

svcsubproc.para: When both doors are locked and the LH door lock rod is moved to the UNLOCK position, or the UNLOCK button on the remote keyless entry (RKE) remote transmitter (if equipped) is pressed, ground is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). When the door lock timer receives ground on circuit 119 (PK/YE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 118 (PK/OG) and ground through circuit 117 (PK/BK) and the doors will UNLOCK.

When both doors are unlocked and the LH side door lock rod is moved to the LOCK position, 12 volts from circuit 120 (PK/LG) is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). If equipped with RKE and the LOCK button on the RKE remote transmitter is pressed, the RKE module sends 12 volts to the door lock timer through circuit 129 (LG). When the door lock timer receives 12 volts on circuit 119 (PK/YE), or on circuit 129 (LG) (if equipped with RKE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 117 (PK/BK) and ground through circuit 118 (PK/OG) and the doors will LOCK.

item.para: Open in circuits 57 (BK), 117 (PK/BK), 118 (PK/OG) or 120 (PK/LG)
Circuit 119 (PK/YE) shorted to ground or power
Inoperative door lock timer
Inoperative door latch remote control

table.title: PINPOINT TEST C: THE DOOR LOCKS ONLY OPERATE ONE WAY

para.emph: C1 CHECK LH DOOR LATCH REMOTE CONTROL

item.para: Disconnect:LH Door Latch Remote Control C552
Set the LH door latch remote control to the UNLOCK position.
Measure the resistance between LH door latch remote control C2333-1, circuit 57 (BK) component side, and LH door latch remote control C2333-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) component side.
Set the LH door latch remote control to the LOCK position.
Measure the resistance between LH door latch remote control C2333-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) component side, and LH door latch remote control C2333-5, circuit 119 (PK/YE) component side.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new LH door latch remote control. REFER to Door Latch Remote Control in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C2 CHECK CIRCUITS 117 (PK/BK) AND 118 (PK/OG) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect: RH Door Latch Remote Control C641
Using the following table, measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333, LH door latch remote control C552, RH door latch remote control C641 and harness side:

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C3 CHECK CIRCUIT 119 (PK/YE) FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between LH door latch remote control C552-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C4 CHECK CIRCUIT 119 (PK/YE) FOR A SHORT TO POWER

item.para: Measure the voltage between LH door latch remote control C552-6, circuit 119 (PK/YE) harness side and ground.

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C5 CHECK CIRCUIT 120 (PK/LG) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect: Door Lock Timer C2333.
Measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333-11, circuit 120 (PK/LG) harness side, and LH door latch remote control C552-5, circuit 120 (PK/LG) harness side.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C6 CHECK LH DOOR LATCH REMOTE CONTROL CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between LH door latch remote control C552-1, circuit 57 (BK) and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C7 CHECK THE DOOR LOCK TIMER FOR CORRECT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all door lock timer connectors.
Check for:
corrosion.
pushed-out pins.
damaged connectors.
Connect all door lock timer connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new door lock timer. REFER to Door Lock Timer in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. Concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test D: The Doors Do Not Lock Or Unlock Using The Remote Keyless Entry Transmitter

svcsubproc.para: When both doors are locked and the LH door lock rod is moved to the UNLOCK position, or the UNLOCK button on the remote keyless entry (RKE) remote transmitter (if equipped) is pressed, ground is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). When the door lock timer receives ground on circuit 119 (PK/YE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 118 (PK/OG), and ground through circuit 117 (PK/BK) and the doors will UNLOCK.

When both doors are unlocked and the LH side door lock rod is moved to the LOCK position, 12 volts from circuit 120 (PK/LG) is sent to the door lock timer through circuit 119 (PK/YE). If equipped with RKE and the LOCK button on the RKE remote transmitter is pressed, the RKE module sends 12 volts to the door lock timer through circuit 129 (LG). When the door lock timer receives 12 volts on circuit 119 (PK/YE), or on circuit 129 (LG) (if equipped with RKE), the door lock timer will simultaneously send 12 volts to both door lock actuators through circuit 117 (PK/BK) and ground through circuit 118 (PK/OG), and the doors will LOCK.

item.para: Open in circuits 57 (BK), 119 (PK/YE), 129 (LG), 489 (PK/BK) or 2002 (OG/BK)
Fuse
Inoperative RKE module
Inoperative RKE remote transmitter
Inoperative door lock timer

table.title: PINPOINT TEST D: THE DOORS DO NOT LOCK OR UNLOCK USING THE REMOTE KEYLESS ENTRY TRANSMITTER

para.emph: D1 CHECK FOR THE CORRECT RKE TRANSMITTERS

item.para: Check that the correct RKE transmitters are being used with the vehicle. Make sure the RKE transmitters are ones provided with the OEM system and not from an aftermarket system, or a dealer-installed system that may have been installed on the vehicle.

para.emph: Are all the correct RKE transmitters present?

entry.para: The system cannot be tested without the correct RKE transmitters. INFORM the customer that all the correct RKE transmitters need to be present to proceed with diagnosis of the system.

para.emph: D2 CHECK THE OPERATION OF THE RKE TRANSMITTER WITH THE KEY IN THE OFF POSITION

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Check the operation of the RKE transmitter. Attempt to LOCK and UNLOCK the doors with the RKE transmitter.

para.emph: Does the system operate correctly now?

entry.para: The system is operating normally. REVIEW the correct operation of the RKE system with the customer.

para.emph: D3 CHECK THE POWER DOOR LOCK SYSTEM FOR CORRECT OPERATION

item.para: Verify the door lock/unlock operation by actuating the driver door lock control switch.

para.emph: Do both doors lock and unlock correctly?

entry.para: GO to Pinpoint Test B to diagnose the inoperative door locks.

para.emph: D4 CHECK FOR COMPLETE FUNCTIONALITY OF THE RKE TRANSMITTER(S)

item.para: Check all the RKE transmitter buttons for correct operation.

para.emph: Do any of the other buttons (panic button) operate correctly?

entry.para: INSTALL a new RKE module with new remote transmitters. INFORM the customer that they must discard all original remote transmitters. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D5 CHECK THE RKE TRANSMITTER BATTERY

item.para: Check the keyless entry remote transmitter battery and verify that it is the correct type.

para.emph: Does the battery have sufficient voltage (at least 2.5 V) and is it the correct type (CR2025)?

entry.para: INSTALL a new battery. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D6 CHECK THE RKE SYSTEM FOR NORMAL OPERATION WITH A KNOWN GOOD TRANSMITTER

item.para: Using the customer's second RKE transmitter or a known good RKE transmitter that is correct for the vehicle, attempt to LOCK and UNLOCK the doors.

para.emph: Do the doors LOCK and UNLOCK with the known good RKE transmitter?

entry.para: INSTALL a new RKE module with new remote transmitters. INFORM the customer that they must discard all original remote transmitters. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D7 CHECK CIRCUIT 489 (PK/BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Disconnect: Instrument Cluster Relay
Disconnect: RKE Module C272
Measure the resistance between instrument cluster relay socket pin 87, circuit 489 (PK/BK) and RKE module C272-1, circuit 489 (PK/BK) harness side.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D8 CHECK CIRCUIT 2002 (OG/BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect:RKE Module C272
Measure the voltage between RKE module C272-9, circuit 2002 (OG/BK) and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage at least 10 volts?

entry.para: VERIFY the power distribution center (PBC) fuse 26 (15A) is OK. If OK, REPAIR circuit 2002 (OG/BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D9 CHECK CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between RKE module C272-14, circuit 57 (BK) and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D10 CHECK CIRCUIT 119 (PK/YE) AND 129 (LG) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect: Door Lock Timer C2333
Using the following table, measure the resistance between door lock timer C2333 and RKE module C272 harness side:

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D11 CHECK RKE MODULE OUTPUT TO THE DOOR LOCK TIMER

item.para: Connect: RKE Module C272
Disconnect: LH Door Latch Remote Control
While pressing the LOCK button on the RKE transmitter, measure the voltage between door lock timer C2333-5, circuit 129 (LG) and door lock timer C2333-8, circuit 57 (BK) harness side.
While pressing the UNLOCK button on the RKE transmitter, measure the voltage between door lock timer C2333-1, circuit 1679 (WH/YE) and door lock timer C2333-4, circuit 119 (PK/YE) harness side.

para.emph: Are both voltages greater than 10 volts at any time?

entry.para: INSTALL a new door lock timer. REFER to Door Lock Timer in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D12 CHECK THE RKE MODULE FOR CORRECT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all RKE module connectors.
Check for:
corrosion.
pushed-out pins.
damaged connectors.
Connect all RKE module connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new RKE module. REFER to Multifunction Electronic Modules in S08307. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. Concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test E: The Remote Keyless Entry Transmitter Has Poor Range Performance

svcsubproc.para: The RKE transmitter sends a radio signal to the remote keyless entry (RKE) module based on the user selected RKE transmitter button that was pressed. The RKE module then carries out the selected action.

item.para: RKE transmitter
Environmental interference
RKE module

note.para: All remote keyless entry (RKE) transmitters must be present to begin diagnosis of the RKE system.
Aftermarket or dealer-installed systems may adversely affect the RKE system operation. These systems should be disconnected before diagnosing any RKE concerns.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST E: THE REMOTE KEYLESS ENTRY TRANSMITTER HAS POOR RANGE PERFORMANCE

para.emph: E1 CHECK FOR THE CORRECT RKE TRANSMITTERS

item.para: Check that the correct RKE transmitters are being used with the vehicle. Make sure the RKE transmitters are ones provided with the OEM system and not from an aftermarket system, or a dealer-installed system that may have been installed on the vehicle.

para.emph: Are all the correct RKE transmitters present?

entry.para: The system cannot be tested without the correct RKE transmitters. INFORM the customer that all the correct RKE transmitters need to be present to proceed with diagnosis of the system.

para.emph: E2 CHECK ALL THE RKE TRANSMITTERS FOR POOR RANGE PERFORMANCE

note.para: The 3 m (10 ft) measurement of range is not the standard but is a guideline that clearly indicates a vehicle is experiencing poor range performance.

item.para: From within 3 m (10 feet) of the vehicle, check all RKE transmitters for poor range performance.

para.emph: Do all RKE transmitters experience poor range?

entry.para: INSTALL a new RKE module with new remote transmitters. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E3 CHECK THE LOCATION OF THE VEHICLE AND THE APPROACH ANGLES AROUND THE VEHICLE

item.para: Make sure the poor performance is consistent in nature and is not from one approaching angle.

RKE transmitter range performance may be degraded in certain locations. For example, if the vehicle is within 0.8 km (0.5 miles) of high-power devices or radio/TV towers, the operating distance of the transmitters may be reduced.

para.emph: Is the poor range performance consistent around the vehicle?

entry.para: The system is operating correctly at this time. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E4 CHECK THE RKE MODULE FOR CORRECT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all RKE module connectors.
Check for:
corrosion.
pushed-out pins.
damaged connectors.
Connect all RKE module connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new RKE module. REFER to Multifunction Electronic Modules. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. Concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test F: The Panic Feature Does Not Operate Correctly

svcsubproc.para: When the remote keyless entry (RKE) module receives a command from the RKE remote transmitter indicating an activation of the panic alarm, the RKE module energizes the horn relay as an audible alarm.

item.para: Remote keyless entry (RKE) transmitter
Horn
RKE module

table.title: PINPOINT TEST F: THE PANIC FEATURE DOES NOT OPERATE CORRECTLY

para.emph: F1 VERIFY THE OPERATION OF THE HORN

item.para: Operate the horn through the steering wheel switch.

entry.para: REFER to Horn in S08307 to diagnose the inoperative horn.

para.emph: F2 CHECK THE REMOTE KEYLESS ENTRY (RKE) TRANSMITTER OPERATION

item.para: Unlock and lock the doors using the RKE transmitter buttons.

para.emph: Do the doors lock and unlock correctly?

entry.para: GO to Pinpoint Test E to diagnose the inoperative RKE system.

para.emph: F3 CHECK CIRCUIT 6 (YE/LG) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect: RKE Module C272
Disconnect: Horn relay.
Measure the resistance between RKE module C272-3, circuit 6 (YE/LG) and horn relay socket pin 85, circuit 6 (YE/LG) harness side.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: F4 CHECK THE RKE MODULE FOR CORRECT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all RKE module connectors.
Check for:
corrosion.
pushed-out pins.
damaged connectors.
Connect all RKE module connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new RKE module. REFER to Multifunction Electronic Modules in S08307. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. Concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. TEST the system for normal operation.
